display_long_description:
**'Blind Simulator'** is a VR simulation game that offers a unique perspective by allowing players to experience the world as a blind person.

Players begin the game without sight and must rely on a white cane as their only tool to explore their surroundings.
Tapping the cane on the ground creates a sonar effect, which temporarily reveals the shapes and objects in the nearby space.


[media]


On the journey to a hospital, players use public transportation such as buses and subways, and navigate crowded streets and unfamiliar environments — all within a fully virtual, safe-to-experience setting.
Through this process'**how to sense and understand the world without directly seeing it**'.


[media]


This game goes beyond a simple simulation — it conveys the everyday discomforts and fears faced by people with visual impairments.
It is designed with an educational purpose and presents a narrative-driven VR experience that resonates with players.


[media]


**Start a new kind of exploration where you learn to "see without seeing" — using sound, vibration, and spatial awareness as your only guides.**


[media]
